What about October 7?

So often this question gets asked, and I don‚Äôt blame you for asking it.

On October 7, a group of Hamas militants set out on a mission to gain at least 30 military captives in order to make a prisoner exchange with over 6,000 Palestinian prisoners in the occupation jails. Many are children, as young as 12. Many are under "administrative detention."

They were faced with a very weak army, and were able to take 250 hostages instead. The IDF activated the Hannibal directive ‚Äî shooting and killing 200 Hamas soldiers, as well as slaughtering several hundred of their own soldiers and civilians.

Angry, humiliated, and openly stating their intent for genocide, occupation military leaders decided to indiscriminately bomb the two million Palestinian civilians living in Gaza. Since October 7th, "Israel" has massacred over 22,000 civilians ‚Äî including over 100 journalists, over 400 healthcare workers, and over 11,000 kids. And 80% of the city has been destroyed, 90% of Gazans has been internally displaced, and zero hostages were retrieved. In fact, the IDF killed 3 of their hostages who had escaped and ran forward waving white flags.

It was never about hostages. It was always about land. And October 7 became occupation's perfect excuse to murder without consequence.
